pull.title: rpcauth: Make it possible to provide a custom password
pull.body: This adds the functionality to specify a custom password to `rpcauth.py`, as well as makes the code (IMO) easier to understand.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

issue.title: `#` cannot be used rpcpassword (or bitcoin.conf in general)
issue.body:
I spent hours trying to solve this bug and the solution was so simple. 
My rpcpassword in my bitcoin.conf file contained a '#' character.

Prevent this from happening, by outputting this an error or warning when users run bitcoind.

Right now, you can have a # character as a password and it will work on the command line but will fail when you JSON-RPC.

`rpcauth.py`, as well as makes the code (IMO) easier to understand.
